2.comment: Josh Johnson tossed 3 picks, but I was pretty impressed with him. He made some nice throws, moved the chains, ran well (5 carries, 40 yards) and even showed great leadership on the sidelines when the team was down. Unfortunately for Johnson (26-of-50, 240 yards, 2 TDs, 3 INTs), Tampa Bay was simply overmatched here. It should be noted how costly Johnson's 3 picks were. Two were thrown in the red zone. The other was deep in his own territory, which led to an Eagles touchdown.    Raheem Morris' brilliant plan to give Johnson tossed 3 picks, but I was pretty impressed with him. Expect Johnson's decision-making. He compiled some junk yardage late, but at halftime was just 6-of-16 for 95 yards, a touchdown and 3 picks (1 on a Hail Mary). Expect Josh Freeman to be the starter once the Buccaneers come off their bye in Week 9. 5.comment: Josh Johnson played for 1 possession. It wasn't until late in the 4.h quarter that Freeman finally guided the Bucs offense to a touchdown. He hit wideout Johnson in the end zone from busted coverage. The pass sailed over Johnson's head, and the Lions settled for another field goal. 7.comment: Josh Johnson throws a short slant to Kellen Winslow* And there's your shot...)    Carolina cruised to a win against Tampa Bay's backup quarterback Josh Johnson. The Buccaneers were without starter Josh Freeman because of a shoulder injury.
